content.question: Mass of <math alttext="N a I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> crystals <math alttext="2.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Color of <math alttext="N a I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> crystals White Color of solid recovered Yellow Color of filtered solution Colorless Mass of dry solid recovered <math alttext="3.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> When students added <math alttext="2.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="N a I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> crystals to <math alttext="100 decimal point milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.</mn><mspace></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="P b, open parenthesis N O 3, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Pb(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, a yellow precipitate formed. After the solution was filtered, the yellow solid was dried and weighed. Data from the experiment are shown in the table above. Which of the following claims is best supported by the observations?

choices.label: A physical change occurred when a new yellow compound was formed.

A physical change occurred when the color of the <math alttext="N a I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solid added changed to yellow when mixed with water.

A chemical change occurred when a yellow, insoluble compound with a larger mass than the original <math alttext="N a I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> formed.
A chemical change occurred when covalent bonds between the yellow solid and water were broken during drying.

content.answer: A chemical change occurred when a yellow, insoluble compound with a larger mass than the original <math alttext="N a I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> formed.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from experimental data.
